Information Collection and Use
Information Collection and Use

We have already under the Terms of Service of the Site specified the kind of information (PII and otherwise) that we require, collect, access, and store during the period of account creation and thereafter during your usage of Services. This includes your name, company, title, country, e-mail address, and method of payment both information pertaining to you as well as information pertaining to third-persons/individual whose resumes you will be uploading for availing the Services. Further, we have also clarified that it is necessary and mandatory for us to be able to collect/store all of this information for you to be able to use the Services and its basic features. You have the right, at any time, to choose not to provide us with any of this information and to ask us to delete the same, if required. However, doing so may result in your subsequent deletion of your account and the inability to continue using any part of Service.
It is pertinent to note that some of the information required by us is mandatory, and we may not be able to complete the registration process in case you do not provide such information.
We may collect following information about you
We may collect following information about you

i) Information including, but not limited to, your name, mailing address, email address, phone number, fax number user preferences may be collected at the time of User registration/account creation on our Site;

ii) In connection with your subscription to our Services, payment details, bank account numbers, billing and delivery information, credit/debit card data and tracking information from cheques or online transfers may be collected to facilitate the transaction.

iii) Information when you interact with our features and Services, including but not limited to, internet protocol (IP) addresses as well as browser type, internet service provider, operating system, browsing patterns, locale and language preferences, number of sessions and unique visitors, usage data and system configuration information, third party links accessed by you etc.
Cookies and Analytic Tools
Cookies and Analytic Tools

We use tools and tracking technologies such as cookies and third-party web analytics services on our Site (such as those of Google Analytics), to store specific information about you and to personalize your visit. Cookies are small bits of data stored on User’s browser that capture small pieces of information while online content is accessed. If you do not de-activate or erase the cookie, our web servers will be notified of your visit to our Site and in turn we may have knowledge of your visit and the pattern of your usage. You can change the configurations of your browser with respect to your cookie preferences, you may choose to accept or reject, disable or be notified when a cookie is sent.

We use cookies and analytics to a) gather statistical information about usage of our Services; b) arrange or modify our resume database to match your preferred interests; c) make our Site more convenient and useful to you; and d) understand your preferences and improve our services accordingly to provide you with the best Services suited to your interests.
Information Storage and Security
Information Storage and Security

All the information that we collect from you during your usage of Services is stored on Amazon Web Services (“AWS”) servers, located in [Mumbai – India and Oregon – USA]. We access the information on the cloud. AWS uses globally accepted standards for ensuring and maintaining the protection, security, confidentiality, and privacy of all data on its servers.

We store your PII only for as long as you have an account with us and for a period of 1 (one) year after deletion of your account, as this is necessary to continue providing you with the Services and for us to maintain a detailed log of the Data that we are collecting. If at any time you deactivate/delete your account, we ensure that all PII pertaining to you is deleted, both from our servers as well as the servers/storage of our third-party service providers with access to the same after completion of 1 (one) year from the date of deletion.

We work hard to protect You from unauthorized access to or unauthorized alteration, disclosure or destruction of any information we hold. Pursuant to the same, we have implemented globally accepted standards and procedures to maintain ongoing data protection and privacy by ensuring the following:

1. Constant review of our information collection, storage and processing practices, including Terms, Privacy Policy, and the physical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to systems;

Usage of Information
Usage of Information
Information submitted to us when you register for our Services and use the features provided by us may be used for following general purposes:
i) to verify your identity and eligibility to register as a User and subscribe to our Services;
ii) to analyze information provided by you regarding job postings and preferences, and to screen resumes and arrange our database to better suit your interests;
iii) to perform data analysis and statistical analysis through our tools to improve the content, and to improve our Services;
iii) to notify you about any changes or modifications to our Site, or terms and conditions;
iv) to respond quickly and efficiently to any queries, feedback, claims or disputes;
v) to identify and protect against any fraud or other criminal activity, and comply with and enforce applicable legal requirements.

We also may use the information we obtain about you in other ways for which we notify you at the time of collection. Your privacy is important to us and we have taken steps to ensure that we do not collect more information from you than is necessary for us to provide you with our Services and to protect your account.
Sharing of Information
Sharing of Information

We do not sell or otherwise share any information about you or provided by you, except as described in this Policy. We may share your personal information to our affiliates and third parties to help us provide and improve our Services. Access to only as much information is made available as is reasonably necessary or required by law. These third parties are not authorized by us to use or disclose the information except as necessary to perform services on our behalf.

In case of restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, sale, merger with or being acquired by any other entity, we reserve the right to transfer or share any information we have about you with such entity and the use of the information thus shared shall be governed by the Privacy Policy of that entity.

Unless otherwise provided in this Privacy Policy, we shall not share any of your information with any third party except for when required in relation to prevention of illegal activities or suspected fraud or when required by law to do so. We also reserve the right to disclose or share user information in special cases, for example, when such disclosure is necessary to identify, contact or bring legal action against someone who may be infringing (or threatening to infringe) or who may otherwise be causing injury to or interference with (either intentionally or unintentionally), our title, rights, interests or property, or those of other Site users, or of anyone else who could be harmed by such activities.

In addition to any third-party service providers who, subject to your prior consent, we may share your information and/or your PII with third party service providers (as mentioned in the Terms of Service), we may disclose any information provided by you on the Site as may be deemed to be necessary or appropriate: (a) under applicable law, including laws outside your country of residence; (b) to comply with legal process; (c) to respond to requests from public and government authorities including public and government authorities outside your country of residence; (d) to enforce our Terms of Service; or (e) to allow us to pursue available remedies or limit the damages that we may sustain.
By agreeing to this Policy, you also explicitly understand and consent to the fact that we may share your PII with other corporate entities and affiliates only for the purposes of:
